Title: Moderator Access Control
Statement:
Given a log string that, when split by newline, contains:

mod_given_new_access: user_1, user_2 (who gets mod access)
action: added, removed (type of action)
mod_take_action: user_3, user_4 (who performed the action)
timestamp: float
Part 1: Basic Implementation

mod_list constructor

Parse the log and store in your chosen data structure
can_remove_mod(user_1, user_2)

Check if user_2 has permission to remove user_1
Condition: user_2 must have become a moderator earlier than user_1
get_mod_list()

Return a list of all current moderators

Parts.statement:
Part 2: Community Extension

Extend the three functions such that each community has its own separate mod list

Part 3: Rank Adjustment

Add demote(user_1), which should account for when the input contains a "demote" action.
Lower the rank/priority of the given user
Example: if current order is [user_1, user_2, user_3], after demoting user_1 it becomes [user_2, user_1, user_3]
